chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Abdullah Bin Dolah was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Contact Probation & Parole 72 hours upon release

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $700.00 to SCM within 24 months or civil judgment.

Provide DNA samle if haven't already been taken. Pay surcharge within 24 months or civil judgment. Court waived all mandatory and non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay. Pay supervision fees as determined by the Dept. of Corrections.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm. Court advised the defendant that he/she may not vote until civil rights are restored.

- NO CONTACT with victims SCM.
- No driving without a valid driver's license.
- Attend treatment and counseling programs determined by agent.

records.addlTxt:
SENTENCING HEARINGPROCEEDED.  Statements made by the parties.

AS TO COUNT 2: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 36 MONTHS to Run Concurrent with Case 22CF3931 with credit for 122 DAYS time served;
 the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS ; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS.  
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 Years. 
Defendant IS  NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

 CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
Pay DNA surcharge within 24 Months or Civil Judgment. 
Court waived all mandatory and non mandatory costs due to inability to pay. 
Provide DNA sample if haven't already been taken. 
Pay Supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Pay Restitution in the Amount of $700.00  to  SCM  wiihin 24 Months or Civil Judgment. 
Contact Probation & Parole 72 Hours upon release.
Attend Treatment and counseling programs determined by agent.
Obtain/Maintain Employment or attend school.
No Contact with Victims SCM
No Driving without a valid driver's license. 
The Court advised the defendant s a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm.
The Court advised the defendant he/she may that as a convicted felon  he/she may not vote until his/her civil rights are restored 


Filed 
Ineligible Voting Notice
Memorandum of Probation.

Defendant Abdullah Bin Dolah in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Abdullah Bin Dolah in custody.  
Student Intern Caroline Pelligrini supevised by Wiulliam Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Burmese Interpreter sworn: Simon KoKO. 


Case in court for a .Plea and Sentencing.  Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.
Court is in receipt Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum.  Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
 
PLEA HEARING PROCEEDED: 

AS TO COUNT 1: 
Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered (Count /Case) DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.


AS TO COUNT 2:  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.   
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  
Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample.



AS TO COUNT 3: 
Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered (Count /Case) DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court, defendant Abdullah Bin Dolah not in court, in custody, appearance wavied.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing date.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Abdullah Bin Dolah in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen; both appear by video.  Defendant Abdullah Bin Dolah in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter: Simon Koko.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Deputy S. Mindel. Court took judicial notice of 21CF3931. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No driving without a valid license.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with S.C.M.

Defendant Abdullah Bin Dolah in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Abdullah Bin Dolah in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Abdullah Bin Dolah appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has lower number case 21CF3931 pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 1.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
